result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: WHITESIDES, JUSTIN A

records.addlTxt:
Case#21CF165, Cts 2-4 DRI
Case#22CF33 - DRI

Case#21CF165, Ct. 1
Court withhholds sentence and places defendant on probation for 3 years with following conditions:
- 1 year in County jail; consecutive to any other sentence.  May serve time in another county if no cost to Chippewa Co.  Huber granted including elec. monitoring.  Must report today.
-  $ 2073.00 fine plus $ 250.00 DNA s/c + $36.40 blood draw
-  Not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs not prescribed.
-  Not to go on premises of any bars, liquor stores or taverns.
-  Orders permanent DL revocation.
-  Complete any counseling, treatment, or assessment per Agent.
-  IID for 12 months on any vehicle in his name.
-  Half-price IID.
-  Provide a DNA sample. 
-  Complete AODA & DSP
-  Must comply with terms of probation & report to probation today.  
-  4 days credit; Attorney Harless may notify the court if differs. 

(Jail/Probation- 5791)

Cases#21CF165 amd 22CF33
11:31 AM Defendant JUSTIN A WHITESIDES in court with Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PTM staff present.
PTM states bond conditions aren't going well.
Court proceeds with sentencing.
